note.p: Corrected proof of "Shakspere-Bacon's Cipher." This one has more than the usual correction.

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: Walt Whitman Papers in the Charles E. Feinberg Collection: Literary File, 1841-1919; Poetry, 1842-1892; “Shakspere-Bacon's Cipher” ( 1891 ), proof sheets with corrections

bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

lg.l: I doubt it not—then more, far more;
In each old song bequeath'd—in every noble page or text,

In every object, mountain, tree, and star—in every birth and
life,

As part of each—finality of‸‸evolved from each—meaning, behind the os-
tent,
